name: Novotel Aix en Provence Beaumanoir Les 3 Sautets

reviews.text: 150 EUR/night I paid for a single room is simply a ridiculous price. The hotel is worth possibly half of that price. It is outrageously overpriced for the quality you get, which is fine for a much cheaper rate.
reviews.title: overpriced

reviews.text: The rate is for a luxury accomodation, which is definitely NOT what you get.
reviews.title: An adequate stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on a coach tour of Provence . The rooms were functional and clean and the staff friendly and helpful Our only complaint was the standard of the restaurant . The buffet breakfast was good however the logistics of the restaurant need reorganising. Of two self service coffee machines only one was operational leading to long waiting times, the toaster didn't work properly and you needed to go all over the restaurant to find food items . As example cereal bowls and spoons were nowhere near cereals and condiments away from the bread .
reviews.title: Functional Hotel

reviews.text: We ate one evening meal in the restaurant and the meals we had were very disappointing ..Another coach party arrived at the hotel a few days into our stay and the restaurant staff had problems coping with large numbers of people having breakfast at the same time
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good overnight stay as it is close to the motorway. This is not a Hotel you would use to holiday in Aix. Free parking is good. Parking around the city centre is quite hard so opted to walk - about 40 minutes at medium pace and is slightly up hill but is quite pleasant. If you don't want to pay for breakfast (quite expensive) there is a good supermarket near by and there is an electric kettle and tea and coffee in the room. There are no restaurants close so you either go to the centre ville or eat at the hotel. This is a functional hotel not a four star hotel.
reviews.title: good stopover
Friendly staff but nothing special
reviews.text: I stayed here about a year ago for a work trip, so knew what to expect. Nothing flash, clean and tidy, good sized rooms. A nice breakfast, but quite expensive. The rooms do have tea and coffee making facilities, a small bar fridge and an in room safe, but no iron. The hotel has free wifi. The hotel is about a 30 minute walk from the centre of Aix. Would I choose to come here if work wasn't making the arrangements, hmm. Probably not, I'd probably try and find something a bit more modern, and closer in to the city. I tend to agree with another reviewer questioning the validity of this being a four star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Novotel in August - a busy time of year but we were pleasantly surprised. The Hotel is on a regular bus route into town (about ten minutes) and was well sheltered from the motorway that runs adjacent to the building.The pool was a little over-crowded for its size in August. Rooms were of a good size - free wi-fi - and well looked after daily by the cleaning staff. The hotel reception was polite and helpful and food in the restaurant was good. We enjoyed our stay - all ten nights!
reviews.title: Friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is OK, but should not be rated as a 4 star. Would be a maximum of 3*, but I've stayed in better 2* hotels.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has a good size, but is dated. Bathroom shower is uncomfortable and badly projected.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's no pillow options, just the regular firm foam available in the hotel. In my opinion, a 4* hotel should offer some pillow options. In my case, I'm used to sleep with down pillows and it's uncomfortable to use a firmer one.
reviews.title: Nice hotel In a residential neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here and found it kept to a higher standard than some Novotels we've stayed at. Free parking was available and a short ride into centre ville. The water temperature in the shower was variable, and the manager assured me it was being taken care of.
reviews.title: A very nice Novotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as part of a Riviera Travel holiday in what is essentially a business hotel that is located in an urbanisation a short bus ride away from the centre of Aix.
reviews.title: Reasonable base for exploring Aix

reviews.text: The number 8 bus stops and picks up in close proximity to the hotel and each journey is 1 Euro. If you buy a carnet from a tabac, it costs 7 Euros for 10 journeys.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: There is a limited menu in the hotel and we dined there on a couple of evenings, but due to its location, we felt inclined to catch the number 8 and go into Aix. Incidentally, the last bus back is just after 10:00 pm, otherwise it's a taxi.
reviews.title: excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aix-en-Provence is a very interesting traditional city and typical for the south of France.
reviews.title: A VERY CONVENIENT AND COMFORTABLE STAY IN AIX

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, finding a good hotel at reasonable price is not that easy, in particular during the great "Opera Festival" in July.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very convenient place is the Novotel Beaumanoir, located at 10 mn by car from city center where it is easy to find parkings ( at reasonable price as well)
reviews.title: This is a lovely hotel with a good restaurant

reviews.text: In this hotel, not only the atmosphere is pleasant, but also the food is excellent!
reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment

aka: Novotel Aix En Provence Beaumanoir Les 3 Sautets Hotel
description: The Novotel Aix-en-Provence Beaumanoir Les 3 Sautets is a 3 star hotel five minutes from the centre of Aix en Provence, close to the TGV station, Marseille Provence Airport and major roads. The hotel offers 102 rooms, a restaurant, bar and ten meeting rooms with a maximum capacity of 180 people. This 3 star hotel is equally suitable for a business trip or a holiday with your partner or family in Aix en Provence. The hotel also features free private parking and a swimming pool.
